feed.title: The Flatterline Blog

entry.content:
There are a lot of great books out there about startups, entrepreneurship and small business and a new book club at CO+HOOTS coworking in Phoenix aims to introduce and discuss some of those books with the local community. The meetup will take place on the first Monday of each month for 1 - 1.5 hours.

Here's the full book list:

2012

  • April — The Lean Startup by Eric Ries
  • May — Rework by Jason Fried & David Heinemeier Hanson
  • June — Ignore Everybody: and 39 Other Keys to Creativity by Hugh MacLeod
  • July — The Startup Owner's Manual by Steve Blank & Bob Dorf
  • August — The Art of the Start by Guy Kawasaki
  • September — Getting Real by Jason Fried, David Heinemeier Hanson & Matthew Linderman
  • October — Do More Faster by Brad Feld & David Cohen
  • November — The E-Myth Revisited by Michael E. Gerber
  • December — Founders at Work by Jessica Livingston

2013

  • January — Crush It! by Gary Vaynerchuk

The first meetup will take place April 2, 2012 at 6pm, so pick up a copy of The Lean Startup from your local library or independent bookseller today and start reading!

If you have suggestions for the book club, please let us know!
entry.summary: A monthly book club is starting in downtown Phoenix geared specifically toward topics on startups and entrepreneurship. Take a look!
entry.title: {Event} Startup Book Club
